intro: Forsteronia spicata, commonly known as the spicate forsteria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a glossy surface. Forsteronia spicata is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
